attributes.action: Lift the official secrets act 1989
attributes.background: To the house of commons, The petition of U.K Taxpayers declares that the Westminister child sex abuse enquiry is being prevented by the official secrets act 1989. The petitioners therefore urge the house of commons to lift the official secrets act 1989. And the petitioners remain.
attributes.additional_details: https://lawrenceserewicz.wordpress.com/2015/04/13/official-secrets-act-and-child-sexual-abuse-inquiry-arcana-imperii-and-the-secrets-of-state/

attributes.action: Have a referendum on health and social welfare funding for the next generation.
attributes.background: Health and social welfare funding is a subject very dear to voters but one whose effects run longer than the lives of any Parliament, or the careers of many Civil Servants or politicians.  Whether the UK has a US or Scandinavian model for health and social provision should be subject to plebiscite.
attributes.additional_details: I am a hospital consultant and fellow of the Royal College of Physicians, and feel that this is one of the bigger issues of relevance to people currently, and one which is not adequately exposed or debated within the short lives of Parliaments.

attributes.action: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people
attributes.background: Media exploits individuals in reality shows etc we need a law to protect people. The law must prevent any waiver of liability and subject media companies to strict liability conditions. A special type of warrant must should be available and the ability to subpoena witnesses for the defence.
attributes.additional_details:
Media exploits individuals in reality shows we need a law to protect people, this includes Shilpa Shetty who was subjected to racist abuse on Big Brother, Patrick Dauncey fell from a cliff in The Island, Jacintha Saldanha committed suicide after a telephone prank & Ajwinder Bains in his Truman Show rip-off

All these people have suffered horrific manipulation and it gets worse each year. It is time for Parliament to act, to deal with this increasing problem. There should be high punitive damages

attributes.action: Start an domestic abuse register
attributes.background: This will enable you to find out if your new partner has ever been charged or suspected of domestic abuse offences and enable you to check court records for non molestation orders issued against them. Domestic abuse is growing and this register would empower the individual to protect themselves

attributes.action: "Superfast" (Fibre) broadband should be made available to Exchange Only lines
attributes.background: During the current "superfast" broadband rollout, many properties are being excluded because they are not connected to roadside cabinets. When these properties were originally connected to their local telephone exchange, cabinets were not in standard use.
attributes.additional_details:
Current regulations say that the new "superfast" technology must be installed outside exchanges in cabinets. Therefore new cabinets should be installed outside existing exchanges (to comply with current regulations) or the regulations should be changed.

Currently the public money being spent on these projects is done so without public consultation. Homeowners and businesses cannot interact with the organisers implementing the projects to ensure fair distribution.

attributes.action: Restrict the speed of cyclists on mixed pedestrian/cyclist paths to 4 mph.
attributes.background: It is becoming very common for local authorities to improve provision for cyclists, at the expense of pedestrians, by making footpaths multi use. By the simple expedient of painting a bicycle on the footpath pedestrians lose the exclusive use of the footpath.
attributes.additional_details:
The figures for death and serious injury to pedestrians involved in accidents with cyclists is very low. But there is a perception of danger especially from inconsiderate riders.
If cyclists were restricted, to 4 mph as are class 2 mobility scooters, this would reduce the perceived threat from cyclists. This would create a compromise in mixing pedestrians with cyclists. This accepts the inevitable use by cyclists of the footpath and protects pedestrians as vulnerable road users.

attributes.action: Make gift vouchers fair and stop companies keeping your money after expiry.
attributes.background: From refusal to issue change or a credit note when only part of a voucher is used to simply keeping your money if the voucher expires, these practices are unfair and should be stopped. I call for legislation to control the sale and terms of gift vouchers so that money is never allowed to disappear.
attributes.additional_details:
While class action lawsuits have been setting precedence in the US, the UK is still behind. 

A survey in September 2010 by Groupola.com suggested that Britons are have nearly Â£580m of unused gift vouchers. Many of these won't be honored by issuers.

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2006/apr/29/consumernews.moneysupplement

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/chill-factore-gift-vouchers-trafford-8532757

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2011/jan/30/are-gift-card-waste-money

attributes.action: Offer more medical school places
attributes.background: The GMC limit the number of places avaliable for students studying medicine at university. By keeping the number of places the same, doctors numbers within the NHS won't rise putting patient care at risk. By offering more places longer term the NHS can employ more doctors and improve patient care

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find Â£8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over Â£10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: Stop local councils cutting low paid jobs without first cutting top salaries.
attributes.background: Recently, Newcastle City Council approved an Â£8500 pay rise for its chief executive despite assurances to the contrary. Many local council chief executives earn more than the Prime Minister and yet jobs lower down the pay scale are cut to save money.
attributes.additional_details: Dan O'Donaghue's article for the chronicle drew this issue to my attention. 30/1/17

attributes.action: Balance the petition system by allowing people to sign both for and against.
attributes.background:
I'm calling for the petition system to take both for and against votes while retaining the 100,000 signatures needed. 
This way overall public opinion will drive the need for a response or parliamentary debate. 
The current system does not give a voice to those people who agree with something.

attributes.action: Raise paternity pay to a minimum of 75% of your weekly income
attributes.background: Currently paternity leave is around Â£140 or 90% of your weekly income whichever is lower. Due to this fathers cant afford to take time off to be with a newborn or have to take annual leave. I myself just had a child and cant take paternity leave as I would be over Â£200 out of pocket each week.
attributes.additional_details: Lets get this to parliament and give fathers the chance to be with their kids from the start. There are all these fathers who don't want to spend time with their kids and the ones who do can't. Lets change this for fathers and kids in the UK lets allow fathers to bond with their newborns. Please sign this petition. THANKS

attributes.action: Give commonwealth immigrants citizenship who lived in this country for 10 years
attributes.background: Most residents have started families here their children have never been out of the country. Most African countries now struggling economically than they were 10 years ago political instability, human rights abuses gender equality

attributes.action: Ban all landlords from stopping tenants having pets.
attributes.background: Currently in the uk millions of people are either private or housing association tenants, that rises each year. At present a landlord can tell a tenant if they can or can't have a pet. Approximately 7 million+ animals enter shelters each year. No landlord should have the right to disallow pets.

attributes.action: Protect employee privacy by making electronic monitoring illegal
attributes.background: In some companies employees are tracked so closely that their managers can see if they pause between tasks or, even stop for a chat. Some companies are even monitoring workers metabolism. Some use 'badges worn by employees to record their movements, interactions and âspeaking patternsâ
attributes.additional_details:
Employment monitoring article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/20/digital-giants-workers-robots-film-employee-monitoring-the-circle

BBC news Which! Report on personal data being sold. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-38694016

New York Times
https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/18/technology/data-crunching-is-coming-to-help-your-boss-manage-your-time.html

attributes.action: Make the licencing fee for the BBC optional.
attributes.background: The BBC has an obvious left wing agenda, I don't watch the BBC but because I have the ability to receive it, forces me to pay for it, Surely in this age of technology it can be a "Pay per view" channel.

attributes.action: Remove the tax on child support for victims of domestic violence.
attributes.background:
The 4 per cent Child Maintenance Service (CMS) collection fee presents real difficulties, particularly for domestic abuse victims.

For victims, a family-based arrangement is mostly impossible to arrange and using the CMS may be the only safe way for victims of domestic abuse to claim support.
attributes.additional_details:
We are calling on the UK Government to protect, not punish victims of domestic violence by removing the 4% collection charge for victim-survivors.

More background information here:

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/child-maintenance-service-single-mother-dwp-snp-child-support-agency-a7505746.html

http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/scottish-news/theresa-urged-abolish-cruel-domestic-9446041

http://www.eveningtimes.co.uk/news/14961377.Charge_is____cruel____tax_on_abuse_survivors/

attributes.action: Make recycling for all businesses compulsory and easily accessible
attributes.background: Cost-effective recycling is a particular problem for small businesses, which often cannot access residential recycling schemes run by councils and may not be big enough to gain attractive contracts for waste disposal from large providers. Landfill tax has risen to Â£84.40 but this isn't working.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government continually increasing the rate to encourage businesses to recycle more of their waste isn't enough.The Federation of Small Businesses (FSB) highlighted this issue, calling for free waste recycling for micro-businesses. The organisation is also calling for better access for all SMEs.

60% of waste that goes to landfill could have been recycled. If the Government want to increase consumption in our economy then they need to do something about it from an environmental point.

attributes.action: Return to the previous method of calculating Child Maintenance Payments.
attributes.background: The new Child Maintenance Service takes an estranged parents income direct from HMRC records.  This means that this now includes "income" listed on the HMRC listing that may be for benefit in kind taxation purposes and not be cash in a parents bank which is grossly unfair.
attributes.additional_details: Rt Hon Damien Green needs to order a review of the changes to return to the old method of calculating CSA payments from net income which is the only disposable income an estranged parent has control over.

attributes.action: Make the speed limits for larger vans the same as cars.
attributes.background: Transit sized vans are restricted to 50mph on single carriageways which anyone that drives one knows is not always a good thing. More time in your van means less work can be done.  Also it seems no one wants to be stuck behind a van at 50mph.  Reckless overtaking of vans is a common occurrence.
attributes.additional_details: Bringing the speed limit in line with cars would be a good thing and could possibly cause less accidents.  Vans are as safe as a lot of cars nowadays.

attributes.action: Pass: Representation of the People Act - Additional Member System (AMS / MMP)
attributes.background: Our voting system forces the major parties to devote to only swing seats. It doesn't treat voters equally. In parts of the country the opposition parties put up nothing more than a token effort in elections. Regions are dominated by one party despite opponents recording substantial numbers of votes.
attributes.additional_details:
"First past the post has been a huge contributing factor in how remote people feel from politics. As vote share for the major two parties has declined, it is a fact that our general elections have become less and less representative ... It should be a source of national concern that there have been three general elections in history in which the party with the most votes has actually lost the general election."

Source: - http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/blog/jonathan-reynolds-speech

attributes.action: guarantee all EU football players be exempt from net migration targets
attributes.background: Parliament needs to guarantee that in the forthcoming Brexit negotiations there will be provision made for the free movement of all EU football players to work in UK Football Clubs. A lot of football supporters need reassurance that this group of workers will be exempted from immigration targets.

attributes.action: Lobby the IOC in order for Darts to become an Olympic Sport.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport should create a task force in order to lobby the IOC for Darts to be recognised as a sport. They should then have direct involvement in the process of applying to become an Olympic Sport at the earliest opportunity.
attributes.additional_details:
Darts meets almost all requirements stipulated by the Olympic charter.

Sports with similar characteristics are currently already included in the Olympic programme such as Archery and Shooting. Darts is a true test of precision, accuracy, strategy, hand-eye coordination and pressure.

We, the undersigned urge the Government to step in, in order for Darts to have the best chance at becoming an Olympic Sport, and to gain the recognition the sport and it's competitors deserve.

attributes.action: Lower the tax rate for health care workers
attributes.background: I request that the government consider lowering the tax rate of 20% over the threshold to 15% for health care workers on lower wages such as care assistance, Nurses. Currently health care workers are many paid at the living wage.

attributes.action: Funding for Birmingham homeless shelters and free education/job seekers help
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We're asking for the government to invest in the UK's second largest city & provide support who most need it. We want free education and job seeker support to help get people off the streets. We also need equipment and resources.

attributes.action: Ensure every local government has homeless shelters and support workers for free
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We are trying to help homeless people by making it legal for all councils to have homeless shelters that are available 24/7. We also want to see an increase in funding for support workers who offer valuable advice.

attributes.action: Apply to rejoin EFTA & retain EEA membership as objective of Art 50 negotiations
attributes.background: We call on HMG to aim for a practical workable realistic outcome in negotiations with the EU. To that end, rejoining EFTA & remaining in the EEA is the only sensible initial route. Any other approach will waste time, to the detriment of us all.

attributes.action: Make tips tax free for waiters and waitresses.
attributes.background: Currently waiters and waitresses have to declare their tips to HMRC. These tips do not form part of the bill and are a thank you gift to the waiter or waitress for providing a great service and working unsociable hours. HMRC will still generate tax revenues from the bill.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing the waiter or waitress to take the money home that night will avoid unscrupulous employers charging them admin fees on tips or taking a share for breakages and spillages.

attributes.action: Set a minimum standard for baby change and feed facilities in food outlets
attributes.background: Having seen my wife breastfeed our 3-month old daughter in numerous baby/parent facilities of varying hygiene and quality, I believe there should be a government-set minimum standard for dedicated rooms including all the following - baby change table, toilet, sink, paper towels and a feeding chair.
attributes.additional_details:
John Lewis and Fenwick's are companies setting high standards.  I have visited worse including M&S stores who combine baby facilities with a disabled toilet (no chair/poor hygiene) and Tesco (no toilet), whilst several Costa branches don't have anywhere private to sit so feeding has to be done standing up in the toilet.
As a father I see my wife feeding our baby in conditions that are poor and unhygienic for both parent/child, whilst I experience the lack of toilet facilities in changing areas.

attributes.action: Halt the rise in Southern train fares until the end of the strikes
attributes.background: The strike by ASLEF and RMT has severely affected the quality of the service on Southern Rail and it could be argued that the price of the rail fare should not be increased until such a time when negotiations between Southern Rail and the Unions reach a close.

attributes.action: Drink in customers use of takeaway cups to be banned due to high waste volume
attributes.background: I work for one of the large chain high street coffee shops and I find it  astounding how much waste is created in these establishments alone, the worst needless waste I have seen is customers requesting takeaway cups to sit in. This needs to stop or legislation brought in to discourage this.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3 Billion disposable coffee cups are used every year in the UK with only 1% being recycled. It is becoming an issue which can not be ignored. I understand that asking people to not use takeaway cups and bring their own is unrealistic but stopping the use of takeaway cups for sit in customers would be a fantastic start towards ending the practice and the needless waste created.

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/mar/16/takeaway-coffee-cups-recycle-environment-waste

attributes.action: Amend the Trade Union Act 2016 to remove trade union immunity from damages.
attributes.background: RMT & ASLEF have been striking for no discernible aim other than to cause harm to the commuters that use Southern Rail. They have wreaked untold costs upon individuals, families & businesses, yet they have legal immunity from the laws that govern every other person & organisation in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
This advantage that gives unions legal immunity from any claims for damages arising from their behaviour, however destructive, is wrong. Even the government has been taken to court by an individual before being allowed to invoke article 50, yet someone that loses their job because of persistent union action has no recourse to the courts, it is unjust and unfair. 

Unjustifiable strikes must stop, unfair advantages must stop.
 
Please help to get the Trade Union Act 2016 amended and remove the unfair trade union immunity from damages.

attributes.action: Give grandparents the same funding as foster parents whether they work or not
attributes.background: Payment for grandparents who have grandchildren fulltime.
attributes.additional_details: Me and my husband work but can only get child benefit for 2 grandchildren who live with us fulltime so if they need clothes or shoes or anything else and it is more than Â£34 we have to pay for it. I think there should be some sort of payment like foster parents get because grandparents are doing the same job.

attributes.action: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes
attributes.background: Use some of the foreign aid budget for the care system instead of council taxes

attributes.action: Ban Triclosan from UK products
attributes.background: The USA Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has banned hand soaps containing triclosan, after ruling that the antibacterial chemical could contribute to antibiotic resistance. Triclosan and other potentially harmful antibacterial chemicals are widely used  in hand washes, deodorants and toothpastes

attributes.action: Increase defence spending to at least 3.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: The number of combat ships in service is woefully low. This isn't acceptable for an island nation. We should have a steady return to 1985 levels , otherwise risk getting caught short , like nearly happened with the Falklands conflict.

attributes.action: Allow HMRC to provide tax exemptions where clerical errors have occurred
attributes.background: I dissolved a company rather than wound it up, and therefore HMRC is applying income tax rather than capital gains tax on the distributions. This was a clerical error, but there is no way to wind back the clock on such errors. HMRC should have the power to apply exemptions under such circumstances.

attributes.action: Promote responsible drinking by enforced water stations in pubs, bars and clubs
attributes.background:
Significantly reduce incidents and Public Sectors costs, following other countries' lead by highlighting re-hydration in establishments with alcohol consumption. 
Eliminate queuing up and faux pas amongst peers by having water and electrolyte fluids available in prominent areas relative to capacity
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol related incidents cost the public sector millions which can be significantly reduced by having easily identifiable water stations in all establishments. 

This can be done by having large containers or a simple bar tap facing the customer and also through encouragement of re-hydration electrolytes in between and after alcoholic drinks. 

NSW in Australia has a similar project already in place and the UK government should follow suit benefiting individuals and the greater community.

attributes.action: Allow 14-15 year olds to consent to sex with someone a maximum of 3 years older
attributes.background: The age of consent is currently 16, and therefore those aged below 16 are prohibited from engaging in sexual; whether protected or unprotected. My proposal is that 14 year olds should be allowed to engage in sexual activity; but only protected, and with partners who are no more than 3 years older.
attributes.additional_details: The age of consent in the UK has been 16 since 1885. Sex education has improved since 1885, and so 14 year-olds nowadays are capable of consenting to safe sex and understand the implications. Most countries in Europe have a lower age of consent than we do, which has led to calls to reduce ours. However, I believe that this is a dangerous move with paedophilia being so common today, and so I believe that my proposal is the best option. Various US states follow legislation similar to my proposal.

attributes.action: To have a legal maximum temperature in the work place.  A maximum of 25 degrees.
attributes.background: Working for long periods of time in constant heat above 30 degrees can lead to health problems  including headaches, vomiting, lung problems, dry skin.  Having a maximum temperature will result in happier staff and staff not needing yo take as many sick days.
attributes.additional_details: Hopefully it can be included in the health and safety at work act.

attributes.action: Allow "hoverboards" to be used on pavements
attributes.background: Currently hoverboards are not allowed on the public pavements. Many countries such as the USA and other EU countries are allowing it and they are after all a useful mode of transport. Unfortunately an out of date highways act says that we can't and it's high tide this is changed.

attributes.action: Limit the resale of event tickets to a maximum of double the face value
attributes.background: Recently I have attempted to purchase tickets for my favourite artists, only to find that they are sold out in seconds.  If this was by genuine fans, then I'd understand. However, its not.  Immediately on checking Stubhub, there are hundreds available that people are buying to make profits from.
attributes.additional_details: Adele tickets, Face Value Â£123.00 selling for over Â£1500 on stub hub within 12 minutes of the sale going live.

attributes.action: Placejob seekers on work programs within 6weeks of oringially signing on
attributes.background: To change the official help and courses job seekers receive down to 6 weeks of being unemployed rather than 6 months - the government needs to recognise that just because that a person has only just signed on, they may have been out of work a lot longer.

attributes.action: Introducing a theory test with Motorcycle Compulsory basic training
attributes.background: Motorcycles are an increasing form of transport, from delivery, commuting to pleasure. New motorcycle riders with no experience can legally ride without adequate training. Learner Motorcycle riders do not need to pass a theory test, producing inconsiderate, dangerous riders with poor road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
Current legislation states that a rider, whether young, old and of all level of experiences can learn to ride a motorcycle on the roads by simply completing a Compulsory basic training course. 
This consists of a manoeuvring and bike control session, then a road competence ride which is supervised.
During the CBT an instructor will assess your knowledge of the Highway code. This is not enough, too many riders put themselves at risk by not fully understanding the rules of the road.

attributes.action: Enable Greater Flexible Working For Parents.
attributes.background: The cost of childcare is not the only barrier influencing parents returning to work (that's another story). Many parents find it incredibly difficult to get a job due to the rigidity of working hours. We shouldn't have to choose between going to work or being a parent. Let's change that!
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can only apply for flexible working arrangements when you have been in employment for 26 weeks. Many job seeking parents cannot work prescribed hours and care for a family, and so they are excluded from the job market. 
Rigid working hours exclude many parents from contributing to society and contributing to their family income.
Enable employers to offer greater flexibility with working hours for parents from the start. Enable flexible start and finish times, not prescribed hours.

attributes.action: Allow some freedom of movement in any UK-EU trade deal
attributes.background: The UK voted to leave to control immigration but that makes a UK-EU trade deal unlikely. The UK government should allow some degree of freedom of movement so we have full single market access. This is means we are able to trade freely yet have some control on EEA immigration.
attributes.additional_details: We should allow free movement of citizens only on the basis that they have paid taxes and NI for 5 years before claiming welfare. They will only be allowed non urgent healthcare if they reside for at least 6 momths. We will allow EEA students to study under Erasmus but introduce a EEA school permit so they will need to pay an annual fee for state education. This reduces pull factor yet it doesn't violate free movement laws. We can compromise on EU structural funds.

attributes.action: Grant legal rights of bodily liberty/integrity to apes, dolphins & elephants.
attributes.background: International scientific studies on genetics, intelligence, emotions and the social lives of these animals have proven to shown these animals are self-aware, autonomous beings.

attributes.action: Stop Private Railway Operators from wheel clamping under Railway Byelaw14
attributes.background: Vehicle clamping by private companies was deemed illegal in England and Wales in October 2012. However, Private Railway Operators can still legally exploit an old Railway Byelaw(14) which allows them to continue an aggressive campaign against railway passengers parking in their car parks.
attributes.additional_details:
They enlist private Contractors to handle this duty, and as a result, are generating thousands of pounds in revenue from excessive use of wheel clamping and by applying disproportionate penalties and release costs, for aggressive commercial gain.

Its time this ended, so please sign this petition if you believe the Department of Transport should take action, to ensure Railway Operators and their private clamping Contractors have to abide by the same Laws as anywhere else in the Country.

attributes.action: Include Religious Studies as a Humanities subject in the English Baccalaureate.
attributes.background: The exclusion of RS from the EBacc is leading to a reduction in the overall understanding of religion in the UK, and suggests that RS is an unimportant subject. In a world increasingly defined by a lack of understanding of religious belief, this is a clear mistake by the Government.

attributes.action: Increase National Minimum Wage to a minimum of Â£20/Â£25 per hour.
attributes.background: Increase the National Minimum Wage to a fair and decent level so those at the lower end of the employment ladder don't just have to survive or fight tooth and nail to get by. Instead of giving people 'benefits' like Tax Credits use that money to reduce Business Taxes so employers can cover the cost.
attributes.additional_details:
People would rather earn a decent wage than feel like they have to be supported on benefits by the government.

Reducing business taxes in this way would encourage more business to set up and invest in their companies. Also would encourage more businesses to set up in the UK.

The government spends an estimated Â£30 billion a year on Tax Credit. Don't give handouts to people give them a decent wage and some pride in themselves.
